more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work
more.description: Conceptual artist Sarah Charlesworth's 1979 study of how newspapers covered a solar eclipse inspired the framework behind The Mutapa Times.

more.title: Zimbabwe women fall to New Zealand in T20I series opener
more.description: The New Zealand women’s national cricket team, the White Ferns, secured a 92-run victory over Zimbabwe in the opening match of their T20 International series at Seddon Park. After Zimbabwe won the toss and elected to bowl, they were immediately put on the back foot. New Zealand’s captain, Amelia Kerr, led from the front with [...]The post Zimbabwe women fall to New Zealand in T20I series opener appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Interpol veteran calls for regional crackdown on Zimbabwe’s high-flying Chivayo wanted by Hawks
more.description: IOL Retired Interpol ambassador and security strategist Andy Mashaile has called for a regional law enforcement crackdown following the issuance of a warrant of arrest for high-profile Zimbabwean socialite and Zanu PF deputy secretary for information and publicity in Harare province, Joachim Chivayo, also known as G6. Earlier this week, IOL reported that the Directorate for Priority Crime [...]The post Interpol veteran calls for regional crackdown on Zimbabwe’s high-flying Chivayo wanted by Hawks appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: NGO petitions Parliament to enact new law protecting Zimbabwe’s senior citizens, pensioners
more.description: A non-governmental organisation, Power of Touch Institution, has petitioned Parliament to enact legislation specifically designed to protect senior citizens, pensioners and retired professionals amid growing concerns over their welfare. Presenting the petition on Monday before the Parliament of Zimbabwe’s Portfolio Committee on Public Service and Social Welfare, the organisation’s leaders, Francis Dembetembe and Beatrice Sithole, [...]The post NGO petitions Parliament to enact new law protecting Zimbabwe’s senior citizens, pensioners appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Tungwarara finally co‐opted into Zanu‐PF Central Committee
more.description: Special Presidential Empowerment Advisor Paul Tungwarara has been congratulated following his co‐option into the Zanu‐PF Central Committee, a development that comes after earlier internal disputes over his inclusion in the party’s second‐highest decision‐making body. Several Zanu‐PF‐aligned Economic Development affiliates applauded Tungwarara’s elevation, noting that he has long supported their activities, including Teachers4ED, Patriotic Vendors4ED, Mapostori4ED, [...]The post Tungwarara finally co‐opted into Zanu‐PF Central Committee appeared first on The Zimbabwe Mail.

more.title: Terms of Reference: Zimbabwe Circular Economy Taskforce (Proposed Framework)
more.description: 1. Purpose of the Zimbabwe Circular Economy Taskforce Zimbabwe is committed to advancing sustainable economic growth, resource efficiency, and environmental stewardship in line with national development priorities, including Vision 2030 and broader climate resilience objectives. To support this transition, the Government of Zimbabwe shall establish a Zimbabwe Circular Economy Taskforce (“the Taskforce”). The Taskforce will [...]The post Terms of Reference: Zimbabwe Circular Economy Taskforce (Proposed Framework) appeared first on The Zimbabwe Mail.

more.title: Six Practical Strategies for Growth Outperformance in Zimbabwean Business
more.description: Growth has always been central to business success, but in Zimbabwe’s operating environment, it has taken on a deeper significance. For many firms, growth is no longer simply about expansion or increased revenue; it is about resilience, relevance, and long‐term survival in a landscape shaped by currency pressures, shifting consumer behaviour, and evolving regional competition. [...]The post Six Practical Strategies for Growth Outperformance in Zimbabwean Business appeared first on The Zimbabwe Mail.

more.title: Zimbabwe Explains Why It Rejected US$367M US Health Funding For Lifesaving HIV, TB, And Malaria Programs
more.description: US$367 Million Rejected: Zimbabwe Government Details Reasons For Turning Away US Health Aid The Zimbabwean government has finally broken its silence to explain exactly why President Emmerson Mnangagwa rejected a massive US$367 million (approximately R6.8 billion) health funding package from the United States—money that was bankrolling lifesaving HIV, TB, and malaria treatment for millions of [...]The post Zimbabwe Explains Why It Rejected US$367M US Health Funding For Lifesaving HIV, TB, And Malaria Programs appeared first on iHarare News.
